alert.note: Alert for Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:24AM CDT until June 14 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL ROGERS AND MAYES COUNTIES... At 723 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles southeast of Adair to 2 miles southeast of Pryor Creek to 2 miles north of Inola, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Verdigris... Chouteau... Chelsea... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Spavinaw... Foyil... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... Taiwah... Tiawah... Strang... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 242 and 272. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
